meanings.definition: Overly detailed or elaborate in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her wiredrawn explanation made the topic harder to understand.
meanings.sent2: The wiredrawn story was so long that I lost interest halfway through.
meanings.sent3: His wiredrawn jokes went on for so long that everyone fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The wiredrawn plot of the movie left the audience confused and bored.
meanings.sent5: The wiredrawn decorations in the room made it feel cluttered and overwhelming.

meanings.definition: To draw out or extend excessively.
meanings.sent1: She wiredrawn the meeting by going into unnecessary details.
meanings.sent2: The teacher wiredrawn the lesson, making it longer than needed.
meanings.sent3: He wiredrawn his chores to avoid doing them quickly.
meanings.sent4: The artist wiredrawn the painting, adding unnecessary elements.
meanings.sent5: The politician wiredrawn his speech, causing the audience to lose interest.
